Flow Control


Defines

#define msg_err(label,)   do { msg(label, 0, __VA_ARGS__); goto err; } while(0)
 log a message and goto "err" label

#define msg_if(label, expr)
 log a message if expr not zero.

#define msg_ifm(label, expr,)   do { if(expr) { msg(label, 0, __VA_ARGS__); } } while(0);
 log the given message if expr not zero.

#define msg_ifb(label, expr)   if( (expr) && (msg_noargs(label, 0, #expr) ? 1 : 1) )
 log a message if expr not zero and enter the if-block

#define msg_return_if(label, expr, err)   msg_ifb(label, expr) { return err; }
 log a message if expr not zero and return err.

#define msg_return_ifm(label, expr, err,)   if(expr) { msg(label, 0, __VA_ARGS__); return err; }
 log the given message if expr not zero and return err.

#define msg_return_sifm(label, expr, err,)   if(expr) { msg(label, errno, __VA_ARGS__); return err; }
 log the given message and strerror(errno) if expr not zero and return err.

#define msg_return_sif(label, expr, err)   do { if(expr) { msg_noargs(label, errno, #expr); return err; } } while(0)
 log a message if expr not zero and return err. (Log the strerror also)

#define msg_goto_if(label, expr, gt)   msg_ifb(label, expr) goto gt
 log a message if expr not zero and goto gt.

#define msg_err_if(label, expr)   do { msg_ifb(label, expr) { goto err;} } while(0)
 log a message if expr not zero and goto to the label "err"

#define msg_err_rcif(label, expr, errcode)   do { msg_ifb(label, expr) { rc = errcode; goto err;} } while(0)
 log a message if expr not zero, set errcode and goto to the label "err"

#define msg_err_ifm(label, expr,)   do { if( (expr) ) { msg(label, 0, __VA_ARGS__); goto err; } } while(0)
 log the given message if expr not zero and goto to the label "err"

#define msg_err_sif(label, expr)   do { if(expr) { msg_noargs(label, errno, #expr); goto err; } } while(0)
 log a message and strerror(errno) if expr not zero; \ then goto to the label "err"

#define msg_err_sifm(label, expr,)   do { if((expr)) { msg(label, errno, __VA_ARGS__); goto err; } } while(0)
 log the given message and strerror(errno) if expr not zero; \ then goto to the label "err"

#define msg_strerror(label, en)
 write a debug message containing the message returned by strerror(errno) write a debug message containing the message returned by strerror(errno)

Detailed Description

In all the macros that follow the msg_ prefix can be substituted by any of dbg_, info_, notice_, warn_, err_, crit_, alert_, emerg_ strings. As you may easily spot, each of these variant is in 1:1 correspondence with syslog(1) error levels. Also the special con_ prefix can be used to redirect the message to the console.

Define Documentation

#define msg_err (  label   )     do { msg(label, 0, __VA_ARGS__); goto err; } while(0)
 

log a message of type label if expr not zero.

Definition at line 42 of file carpal.h.

#define msg_err_if (  label,
expr   )     do { msg_ifb(label, expr) { goto err;} } while(0)
 

log a message of type label if expr is not zero and goto to the label "err" (that must be defined).

expr text statement will be written to the log file.

Definition at line 144 of file carpal.h.

#define msg_err_ifm (  label,
expr   )     do { if( (expr) ) { msg(label, 0, __VA_ARGS__); goto err; } } while(0)
 

log a message of type label if expr is not zero and goto to the label "err" (that must be defined). also logs arguments provided by the caller.

Definition at line 163 of file carpal.h.

#define msg_err_rcif (  label,
expr,
errcode   )     do { msg_ifb(label, expr) { rc = errcode; goto err;} } while(0)
 

log a message of type label if expr is not zero, set variable "rc" (that must be defined) to errcode and jump to label "err" (that must be defined).

expr text statement will be written to the log file.

Definition at line 154 of file carpal.h.

#define msg_err_sif (  label,
expr   )     do { if(expr) { msg_noargs(label, errno, #expr); goto err; } } while(0)
 

log a message of type label if expr is not zero and goto to the label "err" (that must be defined). also logs strerror(errno).

Definition at line 172 of file carpal.h.

#define msg_err_sifm (  label,
expr   )     do { if((expr)) { msg(label, errno, __VA_ARGS__); goto err; } } while(0)
 

log the given message of type label if expr is not zero, log strerror(errno) and goto to the label "err" (that must be defined). also logs strerror(errno).

Definition at line 182 of file carpal.h.

#define msg_goto_if (  label,
expr,
gt   )     msg_ifb(label, expr) goto gt
 

log a message of type label if expr is not zero and goto to the label gt (that must be in-scope).

expr text statement will be written to the log file.

Definition at line 135 of file carpal.h.

#define msg_if (  label,
expr   ) 
 

Value:

do { if( expr ) \
    msg_noargs(label, 0, #expr); } while(0)
log a message of type label if expr is not zero

expr text statement will be written to the log file.

For ex.: warn_if(check(abc) < 0);

Definition at line 54 of file carpal.h.

#define msg_ifb (  label,
expr   )     if( (expr) && (msg_noargs(label, 0, #expr) ? 1 : 1) )
 

log a message of type label if expr is not zero and enter the following if-block.

expr text statement will be written to the log file.

A C-style dbg_ code block should follow. For ex.: dbg_ifb(i == 0) { do_something(); do_something(); }

Definition at line 81 of file carpal.h.

#define msg_ifm (  label,
expr   )     do { if(expr) { msg(label, 0, __VA_ARGS__); } } while(0);
 

log the given message of type label if expr is not zero

For ex.: warn_ifm(check(abc) < 0, "check failed on file %s", filename);

Definition at line 64 of file carpal.h.

#define msg_return_if (  label,
expr,
err   )     msg_ifb(label, expr) { return err; }
 

log a message of type label if expr is not zero and return err to the caller.

expr text statement will be written to the log file.

Example: dbg_return_if(param == NULL, FUNC_ERROR);

Definition at line 94 of file carpal.h.

#define msg_return_ifm (  label,
expr,
err   )     if(expr) { msg(label, 0, __VA_ARGS__); return err; }
 

log the given message of type label if expr is not zero and return err to the caller.

Example: dbg_return_ifm(param == NULL, FUNC_ERROR, "param %d must be not NULL", i);

Definition at line 104 of file carpal.h.

#define msg_return_sif (  label,
expr,
err   )     do { if(expr) { msg_noargs(label, errno, #expr); return err; } } while(0)
 

log a message of type label if expr is not zero and return err to the caller. Log also the strerror(errno).

expr text statement will be written to the log file.

Definition at line 125 of file carpal.h.

#define msg_return_sifm (  label,
expr,
err   )     if(expr) { msg(label, errno, __VA_ARGS__); return err; }
 

log the given message of type label and strerror(errno) if expr is not zero and return err to the caller.

Example: dbg_return_sifm(stat(file, &st) < 0, -1, "file %s access error", file);

Definition at line 115 of file carpal.h.
